description: Comprehensive monitoring dashboard for the Checkout Service providing RED metrics (Rate, Errors, Duration), API endpoint analysis, resource utilization, logs, and traces for complete observability. This dashboard exemplifies best practices for service monitoring with detailed descriptions, actionable thresholds, and comprehensive coverage.

panels.description: Current request rate (requests per second) for the checkout service. Shows the volume of incoming requests over time. Healthy services typically show consistent patterns with expected peaks during business hours.
panels.title: RPS

panels.description: Percentage of requests resulting in errors. Healthy services should maintain error rates below 5%. Values above 10% indicate service degradation requiring immediate attention.

targets.expr: (sum(rate(traces_span_metrics_calls_total{service_name="frontend", status_code="STATUS_CODE_ERROR", span_name="executing api route (pages) /api/checkout"}[5m])) / sum(rate(traces_span_metrics_calls_total{service_name="frontend", span_name="executing api route (pages) /api/checkout"}[5m]))) * 100

panels.title: API Error Percentage

panels.description: 95th percentile response time in milliseconds. This represents the latency experienced by the slowest 5% of requests. Target: < 500ms (green), Warning: 500-1000ms (yellow), Critical: > 1000ms (red).
panels.title: Response Time (p95)

panels.description: Total number of container restarts for the checkout service. Restarts indicate pod crashes, OOM kills, or health check failures. Zero restarts (green) is ideal, occasional restarts (yellow) may be acceptable, but frequent restarts (red, >5) require investigation for underlying issues such as memory leaks, configuration problems, or resource constraints.
panels.title: Container Restarts

panels.description: Request rate per second for each API endpoint. Helps identify which endpoints receive the most traffic and may need optimization or scaling considerations.
panels.title: RPS by API Endpoint

targets.expr: (sum by(span_name) (rate(traces_span_metrics_calls_total{service_name="frontend", status_code="STATUS_CODE_ERROR", span_name=~"executing api route \\(pages\\) /api/checkout|POST /api/checkout|.*CheckoutService.*"}[5m])) / sum by(span_name) (rate(traces_span_metrics_calls_total{service_name="frontend", span_name=~"executing api route \\(pages\\) /api/checkout|POST /api/checkout|.*CheckoutService.*"}[5m]))) * 100

panels.description: 50th and 95th percentile response times for each API endpoint. Shows both typical and worst-case performance per endpoint.
panels.title: Latency by API Endpoint (p50/p95)

panels.description: Tabular summary of key metrics (RPS, API Error %, p95 Latency) for each API endpoint, sorted by request volume. Use this for quick identification of problematic endpoints.
panels.title: API Endpoint Summary Table

panels.description: Top 7 operations with the highest average response time. Useful for identifying the slowest parts of the checkout service that may need optimization.
panels.title: Top 7 Slowest Operations (Mean Latency)

panels.description: Total checkout attempts in the selected time range. Shows overall checkout volume and business activity.
panels.title: Log Records by Severity

panels.description: Recent log entries from the checkout service, including severity levels, trace/span IDs for correlation, and pod information. Use trace IDs to correlate with distributed traces.
panels.title: Checkout Service Logs (100 recent entries)

panels.description: Distributed traces with the longest execution times, helping identify performance bottlenecks in request processing across service boundaries.
panels.title: Top Slow Traces

panels.description: Breakdown of service operations by request volume, showing the relative usage of different checkout service functions and dependencies.
panels.title: Service Dependencies

panels.description: CPU utilization per pod instance. Monitor for sustained high CPU usage that could indicate performance bottlenecks or the need for scaling. Consistent usage above 80% may require investigation.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Memory consumption per pod instance. Monitor for memory leaks or insufficient memory allocation that could impact performance. Sudden spikes may indicate memory leaks.
panels.title: Memory Usage

title: Checkout Service Dashboard
